author: perama
content:
I love it. Pick one unit and stick to it

1 ether
1 nanoether
1 attoether

Or use wei
1 exawei
1 gigawei 
1 wei

But don't use both and have them "mash" in the middle

author: perama
content:
One example might be that the first thing a new user learns is that there is a currency, ether.

Then comes gas

And then comes the word gwei, which leads to wei. That leads to the redefinition of ether in terms of wei, undermining the very first bedrock of knowledge they learned (there is no ether, it's just bundles of wei)

author: sky.cactus
content: Lower barrier of entry to new users into the ecosystem.  I would say that the vast majority of users don't realize that `gwei` is really just "small amounts of ETH".  They think `gwei` is some kind of magical gas unit.

author: sky.cactus
content: If we called it `nanoeth`, I think instead the vast majority of users (anyone educated on SI prefixes, which is everyone but people from a few holdout countries and anyone with a science/math education within those countries) would intuitively understand that gas is priced in ETH if it were priced as `nanoeth`.

author: sky.cactus
content: If you denominate in `wei` you run out of prefixes on the top end.  üòÑ  Yotta to atto gives you a really nice range centered around `ether`, which is the primary measurement of the currency of Ethereum (not `wei`).

author: perama
content: Yeah totally in favour of ether rather than wei
